note.p: Naval officer, clergyman, and author. Lieutenant in the Royal Navy, 1867; retired, 1870. BA, Cambridge, 1873. Ordained deacon, 1872; priest, 1873. Served in several parishes, before becoming vicar of Frocester, Gloucestershire, 1880–2. Rector of Stroxon, Lincolnshire, 1882–5. Incumbent of St Matthews, Dunedin, New Zealand, 1885–7. Published on theosophy.
London Gazette, 6 September 1867, p. 4961, and 15 May 1870
